005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupLine;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
011
012import java.util.Locale;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
016
017/**
018 * A trait indicating that the implementation is a localized definition that is
019 * declared in-line as an instance.
020 *
021 * @param <DEFINITION>
022 *          the associated definition Java type
023 * @param <INSTANCE>
024 *          the associated instance Java type
025 */
026public interface IFeatureDefinitionInstanceInlined<
027    DEFINITION extends IDefinition,
028    INSTANCE extends INamedInstance>
029    extends IDefinition, INamedInstance {
030
031  @Override
032  default IEnhancedQName getDefinitionQName() {
033    return getReferencedDefinitionQName();
034  }
035
036  @Override
037  default DEFINITION getDefinition() {
038    return ObjectUtils.asType(this);
039  }
040
041  @Override
042  default boolean isInline() {
043    // has to be inline
044    return true;
045  }
046
047  @Override
048  @NonNull
049  default INSTANCE getInlineInstance() {
050    return ObjectUtils.asType(this);
051  }
052
053  @Override
054  default String getEffectiveFormalName() {
055    return getFormalName();
056  }
057
058  @Override
059  default MarkupLine getEffectiveDescription() {
060    return getDescription();
061  }
062
063  @Override
064  default String getEffectiveName() {
065    // don't use use-name
066    return getName();
067  }
068
069  @Override
070  default Integer getEffectiveIndex() {
071    return getIndex();
072  }
073
074  @Override
075  @Nullable
076  default Object getEffectiveDefaultValue() {
077    // This is an inline instance that is both a definition and an instance. Don't
078    // delegate to the definition, since this would be redundant.
079    return getDefaultValue();
080  }
081
082  /**
083   * Generates a "coordinate" string for the provided inline definition instance.
084   *
085   * A coordinate consists of the element's:
086   * <ul>
087   * <li>containing Metaschema module's short name</li>
088   * <li>model type</li>
089   * <li>definition name</li>
090   * <li>hash code</li>
091   * </ul>
092   *
093   * @return the coordinate
094   */
095  @SuppressWarnings("null")
096  @Override
097  default String toCoordinates() {
098    IModule module = getContainingModule();
099    return String.format("%s-inline-definition:%s:%s/%s@%d",
100        getModelType().toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT),
101        module.getShortName(),
102        getContainingDefinition().getName(),
103        getName(),
104        hashCode());
105  }
106}
